articles.headline: Obama Aims to Lift the Global Economy, and Maybe Himself
articles.snippet: Mr. Obama will arrive at an international economic meeting in Australia hoping to press European and Asian leaders to get their economies moving again — and perhaps buoy his own presidency.
articles.abstract: Mr. Obama will arrive at an international economic meeting in Australia hoping to press European and Asian leaders to get their economies moving again — and perhaps buoy his own presidency.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Facing a Republican resurgence that is blocking virtually every policy move, President Obama will arrive at an international economic meeting in Australia this weekend hoping to press European and Asian leaders to get their economies moving again — and perhaps buoy his own foundering presidency.

articles.headline: YouTube Music Key Is Introduced as New Rival in Streaming
articles.snippet: As YouTube pushes into paid content, other online music outlets are being forced to defend or change their business models to better compensate artists.
articles.abstract: As YouTube pushes into paid content, other online music outlets are being forced to defend or change their business models to better compensate artists.
articles.lead_paragraph: For nearly a decade, YouTube has offered a smorgasbord of free music, making just about every song imaginable — from Top 40 to ukulele covers — available at a click. But soon the site, whose more than one billion monthly visitors make it the world’s most popular music platform, will start charging for additional perks.

articles.headline: Hasbro Is Said to Be in Talks to Buy DreamWorks Animation
articles.snippet: The DreamWorks chief executive, Jeffrey Katzenberg, is said to be seeking more than $30 a share for the studio, Hollywood’s smallest.
articles.abstract: The DreamWorks chief executive, Jeffrey Katzenberg, is said to be seeking more than $30 a share for the studio, Hollywood’s smallest.
articles.lead_paragraph: Shrek could soon share a home with the Transformers and little ponies like Fluttershy and Twilight Sparkle if their corporate parents are able to seal a deal.
articles.byline: By Andrew Ross Sorkin and Michael J. de la Merced

articles.headline: Army Cuts Hit Officers Hard, Especially Ones Up From Ranks
articles.snippet: Faced with declining budgets, the Army has had to cut its force, and, for reasons the Army has not explained, the largest group of officers being pushed out — nearly one in five — began as enlisted soldiers.
articles.abstract: Faced with declining budgets, the Army has had to cut its force, and, for reasons the Army has not explained, the largest group of officers being pushed out — nearly one in five — began as enlisted soldiers.
articles.lead_paragraph: FAYETTEVILLE, N.C. — For all the insecurities of war, Capt. Elder Saintjuste always figured the one thing he could count on from the Army was job security.

articles.headline: Debts Canceled by Bankruptcy Still Mar Consumer Credit Scores
articles.snippet: The practice, under investigation by the Justice Department, affects tens of thousands of Americans, impairing their ability to secure housing and jobs.
articles.abstract: The practice, under investigation by the Justice Department, affects tens of thousands of Americans, impairing their ability to secure housing and jobs.
articles.lead_paragraph: In the netherworld of consumer debt, there are zombies: bills that cannot be killed even by declaring personal bankruptcy.

articles.headline: In Climate Deal With China, Obama May Set 2016 Theme
articles.snippet: The landmark agreement to cut greenhouse gas pollution is a bet by President Obama that the environment will be a winning cause for Democrats.
articles.abstract: The landmark agreement to cut greenhouse gas pollution is a bet by President Obama that the environment will be a winning cause for Democrats.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — President Obama’s landmark agreement with China to cut greenhouse gas pollution is a bet by the president and Democrats that on the issue of climate change, American voters are far ahead of Washington’s warring factions and that the environment will be a winning cause in the 2016 presidential campaign.

articles.headline: Web of Incentives in Fatal Indian Sterilizations
articles.snippet: People who took part in a sterilization drive in the state of Chhattisgarh that led to 13 deaths described an assembly-line atmosphere with little regard for hygiene.
articles.abstract: People who took part in a sterilization drive in the state of Chhattisgarh that led to 13 deaths described an assembly-line atmosphere with little regard for hygiene.
articles.lead_paragraph: AMSENA, India — Rekha Nirmalkar already had children, and her family was poor. So when a local health worker offered her twice her husband’s daily wages to get sterilization surgery, she jumped at the chance.
articles.byline: By Ellen Barry and Suhasini Raj

articles.headline: Takata Offers Its Rebuttal to Report of Secret Airbag Tests
articles.snippet: The Japanese manufacturer said the accusations that it knew of defects in its airbags but did not report them confuse “multiple events occurring at different times.”
articles.abstract: The Japanese manufacturer said the accusations that it knew of defects in its airbags but did not report them confuse “multiple events occurring at different times.”
articles.lead_paragraph: The airbag maker Takata issued a statement Wednesday night offering a “substantive rebuttal” to accusations by two former employees that the company carried out tests on airbags in 2004 in Michigan and found signs of defects but did not report the results to federal regulators.

articles.headline: Warren Buffett to Buy Duracell in $4.7 Billion Stock Deal
articles.snippet: Berkshire Hathaway, the conglomerate run by Warren E. Buffett, will acquire Duracell using a transaction aimed at lowering the tax bill.
articles.abstract: Berkshire Hathaway, the conglomerate run by Warren E. Buffett, will acquire Duracell using a transaction aimed at lowering the tax bill.
articles.lead_paragraph: As a deal maker, Warren E. Buffett has shown a number of preferences. One is for well-known brand names and another, for finding a way to buy them without incurring a huge tax bill.
articles.byline: By Michael J. de la Merced
